sentence.text: Here, we report that mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint is highly overexpressed in multiple lung adenocarcinoma cell lines and tumor tissues.

Clinically, mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint expression is positively associated with tumor size, T-stage, and N-stage, and Kaplan-Meier analysis revealed that heightened TRIP13 expression is associated with lower overall survival.
mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint promotes lung adenocarcinoma cell proliferation, clonogenicity, and migration while inhibiting apoptosis and G2/M phase shift in vitro.
Accordingly, mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint-silenced xenograft tumors displayed significant growth inhibition in vivo.

In conclusion, heightened mitotic spindle assembly checkpoint expression appears to promote lung adenocarcinoma tumor progression and displays potential as a therapeutic target or biomarker for lung adenocarcinoma
